## RemirrorProps.onStateChange() method

If this exists the editor becomes a controlled component. Nothing will be updated unless you explicitly set the value prop to the updated state.

Without a deep understanding of Prosemirror this is not recommended.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
onStateChange?(params: RemirrorStateListenerParams<GExtension>): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  params | <code>RemirrorStateListenerParams&lt;GExtension&gt;</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`void`
